name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"99912d75-b810-415a-a949-d2d07d9a0335","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: analyze_allfunction","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f862a8dc-15aa-461a-99d2-f0a0caf84641","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"analyze_allfunction","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function is a high-level orchestrator that performs a comprehensive, iterative analysis of every function within the project's internal modules. It implements a "fixed-point" algorithm, repeatedly scanning and analyzing methods until the set of discovered modules and functions remains stable across iterations. This ensures that even deeply nested or dynamically discovered code paths are fully resolved.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"df5488b2-955b-433b-ae62-6e491d50c98b","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Static analysis often faces hidden dependencies: analyzing Function A might reveal an import that leads to Module B, which contains Function C. A single pass over the code might miss these downstream relationships. By iterating until no new modules are found, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"analyze_allfunction","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" guarantees that the analysis is exhaustive. It ensures that the call graph, type definitions, and side-effect records are complete and reflect the entire reachable codebase, rather than just the initial entry points.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"78d7e550-6849-4a24-a3c7-3fdc17cffd3c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1a6bc9d8-c66e-4518-aea5-154440b0eb44","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Iterative Loop:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" The function enters a ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"while","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" loop that continues as long as the state of analyzed modules is changing.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c181e279-6036-4bc7-b894-2afffda20f48","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Fixed-Point Check (","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"equal","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"):","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" At the end of each iteration, it compares the current list of internal modules with the list from the previous pass (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"prev","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). If they are identical, the analysis has "converged" and stops.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"205bd6f9-22bc-4298-abea-fe955f88a43c","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Local Analysis (","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"analyze_local","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"):","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" For every module currently known to the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module_manager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":":","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"7740d396-b22f-4966-9faa-faeca80619a1","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It retrieves all methods (functions/classes) registered to that module.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5c4d2f4b-f8be-43d9-a421-f317ba07391c","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It forces the analyzer to enter each method via ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"pushStack","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"469eb722-8d13-431a-93f2-52d4a74b4714","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It uses ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"isEntry=True","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"isVisited=False","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to ensure that the code is thoroughly analyzed and side effects are propagated, even if the method was encountered previously.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"ad79ece8-8bcc-4518-873e-c467f6998ef1","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Growth:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If during these visits new modules are imported or discovered, they are added to the internal list, which triggers another full iteration of the loop.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"70c22469-eaac-4f2b-9468-e2665e6394a2","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Iteration 1: Analyze ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"main.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Discovers ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"utils.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
Iteration 2: Analyze ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"main.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (updated context) and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"utils.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"utils.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" imports ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"db.py","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".
Iteration 3: Analyze ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"main","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"utils","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"db","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". No new modules found.
Iteration 4: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"equal","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" returns ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"True","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Analysis concludes.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e354e6bf-ef01-4000-84a2-ec8eab8fb171","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"cfd88a53-171f-469d-b422-4e565c04427f","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sub-functions","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0cd86f73-57f7-460c-858b-823ca9c8e501","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: analyze_local","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"84446c6a-5b90-4535-9ecd-9ac00daef586","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Analyzes all methods defined within a specific module. It retrieves each method’s definition and pushes it onto the analysis stack as an entry point for traversal.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b2330b1f-91d3-4131-8d24-368b587e053f","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: equal","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4e6197e1-a43b-4fda-b633-cd338974cd94","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Checks whether the set of internal modules has stabilized between iterations. It is used to determine convergence of the analysis loop and stop further processing once no new modules are discovered.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6b4f6c63-3449-42e9-9f64-1d03d57e52eb","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
